column6: is being played by ten teams from across Mexico. According to ancient texts the ball game was seen as a struggle between light and darkness and provided the energy to keep humanity going.   One of the best preserved ball courts can be found - with stone rings to throw the ball through - in Mexico‚Äôs Yucatan peninsula   Today the game is played by teams of seven players
column7: who knock a heavy solid rubber ball up and down a narrow pitch
column8: using their hips rather than their feet. Giant ball courts can still be seen in ruins across the region. In ancient times losers of the game were often sacrificed to the Gods*
